# l wish l was
back there#

some direction #

convince time to slow up #

knowwhere l'm goin' #

#To know ifwe should believe

just to let things be #

in this brand-new world #

# So it's real real to me #

#That we must
Iook inside our hearts #

comments.author: Dana McNair

comments.text:
When I think of home
I think of a place where there's love overflowing
I wish I was home
I wish I was back there with the things I been knowing

Wind that makes the tall trees bend into leaning
Suddenly the snowflakes that fall have a meaning
Sprinklin' the scene, makes it all clean

Maybe there's a chance for me to go back there
Now that I have some direction
It would sure be nice to be back home
Where there's love and affection
And just maybe I can convince time to slow up
Giving me enough time in my life to grow up
Time be my friend, let me start again

Suddenly my world has changed it's face
But I still know where I'm going
I have had my mind spun around in space
And yet I've watched it growing

If you're list'ning God
Please don't make it hard to know
If we should believe in the things that we see
Tell us, should we run away
Should we try and stay
Or would it be better just to let things be?

Living here, in this brand new world
Might be a fantasy
But it taught me to love
So it's real, real to me

And I've learned
That we must look inside our hearts
To find a world full of love
Like yours
Like me

Like home...﻿

comments.text:
Trivia: Diana Ross actually sang this song live on camera instead of miming 
to vocals that would be recorded later on. This allowed her to really let 
loose with her vocals. Lena Horne, who played Glinda, was allowed the same 
perk with her rendition of "Believe In Yourself".﻿

herself,because when it appeared on Broadway it was a sucess and more than

comments.author: bassest4

comments.author: Donnymac

comments.text:
+bassest4 The Wiz would not have been made without Diana Ross. Period.
Universal was NOT influenced by Berry Gordy. No other Movie Studio would 
even touch THE WIZ and then when Miss Ross wanted the role SHE GOT IT. 
PERIOD. So either you like it, or you don't
10% of the worlds population probably knows who Mills is...100% of the 
worlds population knows who Diana Ross is.
I rest my case
comments.author: thewizboy

comments.text:
Diana Ross got t this role because of the influence of Berry Gordy,,.and he 
did not feel she was right for this part.  Universal would not have cast he 
into this role without the influence of Berry Gordy, and yes I know 
Stephanie Mills was not considered for this part and that was a shame 
because she should have.  Bankable or not Berry Gordy knew she was not 
right for this part but she got it anway. Diana Ross maybe in your opinion 
in a class by herself but Stephanie Mills is in a class ny herself when it 
came to the Wiz.
comments.author: bassest4

comments.text:
@ bassest4 Actually Berry never gave Diana anything. He actually thought 
she was not right for the role of Dorothy and tried to talk her out of it. 
Stephanie Mills was NEVER considered nor was she EVER asked to be part of 
this film.
Actually no Major Movie Studio even wanted to produce THE WIZ into a film 
until Miss Ross showed interest. Universal gave Diana the role after she 
campaigned for it and Berry finalized the deal because of Motown's 
involvement, but it was ultimately Universal Pictures who wanted Diana Ross 
because Miss Ross was a well known bankable Movie star during the 70s and 
they felt very confident in her to do THE WIZ. Without Diana Ross we would 
NEVER even have a movie of THE WIZ in the first place. She is the reason 
there is a film in the first place.
Lastly, even though Mills and Ross has two different singing styles does 
not mean Miss Ross is any less of a powerful vocalist as proven here on 
HOME. Diana Ross is in a class all by herself and has never been worried 
about any competition.
comments.author: thewizboy

comments.text:
political comment. To me, this is more about the problem of 
racism/slavery/freedom than anything made now, because, back then, the 
problem was not a legendary thing heard by coincidence in school, these 
artists had a real struggle to go along with, they had to fight to prove 
themselves against a white system. She's singing to God with such an 
intensity.  She makes me believe. So, mr. Quincey Jones went there, wrote 
some music for Diana, met a young Michael. It's not only about music, it'a 
about a world changing. Only respect for those legendary artists and human 
beings. ﻿

comments.text:
Jennifer Hudson playing the Florence Ballard based character on Dreamgirls 
leaves Diane Ross here in the dust!

This poorly casted film version of the TONY Award theatre production of THE 
WIZ and the character made famous by Stephanie Mills is another "Diane Ross 
Show" that after "Lady Sings The Blues", her first, well received debut 
film, when followed by "Mahogany" & "The Wiz", critics and the public by 
poor Box Office sales determined her Hollywood welcome was over!

every vein in her neck haha. Totally underrated movie and Diana Ross is

the talent of Miss Ross. She sings home with pure conviction and emotion.

and you forgot...at that age!...Diana was 33/34 here. an age when people

singing her heart out. and all that history of ross up till this point. I 
watched this movie again yesterday and still really love it! I watch it 
with a little sadness now knowing all the main actors are gone...and it

comments.author: TWTR4EVER

comments.text:
+TWTR4EVER Many critics also LOVED THE WIZ as well. Any OZ film is not well 
received because of the 1939 film. Most OZ films get negative reviews. 
"Return To OZ' and "OZ The Great And Poweful" were both criticized heavily. 
So what. But THE WIZ also got many great praise by critics also.
READ EM AND WEEP TWATBRAIN4EVER. Your so jealous of Diana Ross its pathetic
- Fabulous is the word for The Wiz...A colossal entertainment. Everyone is 
just plain perfect. - Rex Reed

- Great fun, color, style & flair. It works delightfully. You want to jump 
up & dance along. - Jay Carr, Detroit News

- Ross is superb in The Wiz; her performance ranks with that of Streisand 
in Funny Girl & Minnelli in Cabaret. - Gene Siskel, Chicago Tribune

- Diana Ross is a Whiz in The Wiz. - Scott Cain, Atlanta Journal

- Ted Ross as the lion is simply wonderful in his exuberance & confidence 
as he searches for courage. Mabel King is another knockout standout as the 
wicked witch. Michael Jackson shows charm & compassion as Scarecrow & 
Nipsey Russell is a pleasant surprise as the tin man. - Rona Barrett, ABC TV

The Big New Hit In Town! 4th Week in its Exclusive San Francisco Run! - SF 
Chronicle

- It's slick & energetic & fun. Great moments & a lot of life, sensational 
special effects & costumes. - Roger Ebert, Chicago Sun Times

- Even if you've watched The Wizard of Oz every one of the 18 times it's 
been on tv, chances are you've never seen anything like The Wiz. - Susan 
Slobojan, Detroit News

Hallelujah! It's celestial take-off time at the movies again. Within the 
framework of a musical fantasy, Lumet's spectacular, joyous production of 
The Wiz generates a mood of wonder & sentimental rapture recalling the 
arrival of the Mother Ship in Close Encounters of the 3rd Kind. A sublimely 
happy movie-going experience. The Wiz is a marvel & it should be an 
enduring source of pleasure to several generations of movie-going kids, 
families & fantastists. You come out of this movie feeling blissfully moved 
& glad to be alive. -Gary Arnold, Washington Post

- I loved The Wiz! I think the movie version is just wonderful. Lumet 
creates absolute magic. I wanted to cheer. The Wiz makes you feel good. - 
Walter Spencer, WOR Radio

- The Wiz is among the most visually exciting film musicals ever made...It 
is enchanting when you are ogling it, laughing at the gags, listening to 
the songs or tapping to the rhythm. Oz is now New York & the effects are 
fabulous. - William Wolf, Cue magazine
